intro: Polycarpon alsinifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf nightshade, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into spherical, smooth fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Botanically, it belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes.
